abstract: While Facebook and Twitter encourage users to say what’s on their minds, Blippy asks people to share their spending habits, The Associated Press writes in a profile of the start-up.
snippet: While Facebook and Twitter encourage users to say what’s on their minds, Blippy asks people to share their spending habits, The Associated Press writes in a profile of the start-up.
lead_paragraph: Facebook and Twitter have prodded people to broadcast just about anything, from what they ate for lunch to what movie they’re going to see. Now a new site wants to unearth more — by asking people to automatically reveal things they buy.
